top_comments_top.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.

Confident people this... 

Confident people that... 

It's worth noting however that confident does not necessarily equal right. And confident does not necessarily equal loving. 

In a genuine loving relationship among friends, spouses, parents (towards their children), ideas, dreams, values are exchanged and shared. 

Someone constantly berating, belittling a person's dreams can certainly take a toll in a relationship that is supposed to be loving--we're all human. (Most of us at least!)

Best solution in that case: get away from that relationship, or avoid such relationships like the plague!
Having self-esteem without the encouragement of a peer group is very difficult.

My self esteem was completely eradicated by my mother since my childhood. She was 100% responsible for my low self esteem.

Now that I’m a much older adult, my sled esteem is much better because of age and experience. However, it will never reach its potential because even though wounds heal, but scars stay there forever.
The first step for me was deleting Facebook.
